Beginner Level

Interactive Quizzes

  • Articles Quiz - 5 questions
  • Plural Nouns Quiz - 5 questions
  • Present Simple Quiz - 5 questions
  • Present Continuous Quiz - 5 questions
  • Subject Pronouns Quiz - 5 questions
  • Possessive Adjectives Quiz - 5 questions

Quick Review Questions

Articles

Choose the correct article:

  1. I saw ___ elephant at the zoo.

    • a) a
    • b) an
    • c) the

  2. ___ sun is very bright today.

    • a) A
    • b) An
    • c) The

Answers: 1-b, 2-c

Plural Nouns

Write the plural form:

  1. book → ______
  2. child → ______
  3. woman → ______

Answers: 1-books, 2-children, 3-women

Present Simple

Complete with the correct form:

  1. She _____ (work) in a hospital.
  2. They _____ (not like) coffee.
  3. _____ you speak English?

Answers: 1-works, 2-don't like, 3-Do

Present Continuous

Choose the correct form:

  1. Right now, I _____ my homework.

    • a) do
    • b) am doing
    • c) does

  2. The children _____ in the garden.

    • a) are playing
    • b) is playing
    • c) play

Answers: 1-b, 2-a

Subject Pronouns

Replace with the correct pronoun:

  1. John is tall. _____ is my friend.
  2. Mary and I are students. _____ study English.
  3. The book is interesting. _____ is on the table.

Answers: 1-He, 2-We, 3-It

Possessive Adjectives

Complete with my, your, his, her, its, our, their:

  1. This is _____ car. (belonging to me)
  2. Where is _____ bag? (belonging to you)
  3. The cat is cleaning _____ fur.

Answers: 1-my, 2-your, 3-its

Intermediate Level

Interactive Quizzes

  • Past Perfect Quiz - 5 questions
  • Modal Verbs Quiz - 5 questions
  • Passive Voice Quiz - 5 questions
  • Conditionals 1 & 2 Quiz - 5 questions
  • Relative Clauses Quiz - 5 questions
  • Reported Speech Quiz - 5 questions

Quick Review Questions

Past Perfect

Complete with past perfect:

  1. When I arrived, she _____ already _____ (leave).
  2. They _____ never _____ (see) such a beautiful sunset.

Answers: 1-had left, 2-had seen

Modal Verbs

Choose the correct modal:

  1. You _____ wear a helmet when riding a bike.

    • a) can
    • b) must
    • c) might

  2. It _____ rain tomorrow.

    • a) should
    • b) must
    • c) might

Answers: 1-b, 2-c

Passive Voice

Change to passive voice:

  1. The teacher explains the lesson. → The lesson _____ by the teacher.
  2. Someone stole my bicycle. → My bicycle _____.

Answers: 1-is explained, 2-was stolen

Conditionals 1 & 2

Complete the conditional:

  1. If it _____ (rain), I _____ (stay) home. (Type 1)
  2. If I _____ (be) rich, I _____ (travel) the world. (Type 2)

Answers: 1-rains, will stay 2-were, would travel

Relative Clauses

Combine using who, which, that:

  1. The man lives next door. He is a doctor. → The man _____ lives next door is a doctor.
  2. I bought a book. It was very expensive. → The book _____ I bought was very expensive.

Answers: 1-who, 2-that/which

Reported Speech

Change to reported speech:

  1. "I am tired," she said. → She said _____.
  2. "Where do you live?" he asked. → He asked _____.

Answers: 1-that she was tired, 2-where I lived

Advanced Level

Interactive Quizzes

  • Subjunctive Mood Quiz - 5 questions

Quick Review Questions

Subjunctive Mood

Complete with subjunctive:

  1. I suggest that he _____ (go) to the doctor.
  2. It's important that she _____ (be) on time.

Answers: 1-go, 2-be

Inversion

Rewrite using inversion:

  1. I have never seen such a beautiful sunset. → Never _____ such a beautiful sunset.
  2. She not only sings but also dances. → Not only _____ but she also dances.

Answers: 1-have I seen, 2-does she sing

Cleft Sentences

Rewrite as cleft sentence:

  1. John bought the car yesterday. → It was _____ who bought the car yesterday.
  2. I need your help. → What _____ is your help.

Answers: 1-John, 2-I need

Conditionals 3 & Mixed

Complete the conditional:

  1. If she _____ (study) harder, she _____ (pass) the exam. (Type 3)
  2. If I were you, I _____ (accept) that job offer yesterday. (Mixed)

Answers: 1-had studied, would have passed 2-would have accepted

Ellipsis & Substitution

Complete with ellipsis or substitution:

  1. "Are you coming to the party?" "I hope _____."
  2. My car is faster than _____ (your car).

Answers: 1-so, 2-yours

Participle Clauses

Rewrite using participle clause:

  1. Because she was tired, she went to bed early. → _____ tired, she went to bed early.
  2. The man who is standing there is my teacher. → The man _____ there is my teacher.

Answers: 1-Being, 2-standing

How to Use This Quiz

  1. Read each question carefully
  2. Think about the grammar rule
  3. Choose or write your answer
  4. Check the answers provided
  5. Review any topics you found difficult

Next Steps

  • For more practice, visit our Interactive Exercises
  • Study specific grammar topics in our Grammar Section
  • Test your overall level with our Placement Test

Practice makes perfect! Keep studying and testing yourself regularly.
